page.title: 15ELMSTONE HARDWICKE CHURCH
page.content: {Elmstone Hardwicke Church}is dedicated to St. Mary Magdalene. It was built in Norman times and is made of Cotswold stone. It used to belong to the Benedictine Monastery at Deerhurst,10 Km away. The church is small,it has a nave,chancel,south aisle and porch. The church yard is interesting.The oldest grave stone was dated 1625. The next oldest was 1695 and belonged to Suzanna Lyle. It said {"Here resteth the body of Suzanne {Lyle,widow,who was buried on the 9th {March A.D.1695 aged 61 years "} Some of the oldest graves were the best preserved because they were under the trees. The oldest trees were the Yews ; they might even be as old as some of the graves.
